div1.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT, WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Peti- tion of THOMAS L. THURSTON for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. }
S T I P U L A T I O N

IT IS STIPULATED by and between J. HENRY DENNING, attorney for the Petitioner, and CLAY ALLEN, attorney for the respondent herein, O.P. Halligan, that the records of the United States District Court for the Territory of Alaska, Fourth Judicial Division, sitting at Iditarod, would, if the same could now be offered as a part of the record in this cause, show as follows:

That the above entitled petitioner, Thomas L. Thurston, together with his wife, Agnes V. Thurston, were indicted under Section 195 of the Penal Code, the same being Cause No. 44-1, criminal causes and thereafter, in the same entitled cause an arraignment of the defendant Thomas L. Thurston was had a plea of not guilty was entered by each of the said defendants, and thereafter, in the same entitled cause, a jury was empanelled and a verdict of guilty was rendered against the said defendants, and each of them; that thereafter, in the same entitled and numbered cause, a judgment was entered, a copy of which is attached to and made a part of the respondent's return herein;

That this stipulation shall be taken and have the same force and effect as the original instruments and entries made upon the books, records and dockets of the
United States court in said District of Alaska, Fourth Division, sitting at Iditarod, as evidence in this cause.

IT IS FURTHER STIPULATED that either of said coun- sel may, within a period of sixty hereafter, file herein the originals, or certified copies under the seal of the Clerk of the United States District Court of Alaska, Fourth Division, of any or all of the docket entries, orders, judgments or other instruments or memoranda, con- cerning the proceedings had in said cause; and the said instruments so filed shall be taken and considered as filed of this date.
Dated at Seattle, Washington, this 27th day of December, A.D. 1915.
J. Henry Denning Attorney for Petitioner.
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Petition of Thomas L. Thurston for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
S T I P U L A T I O N.
FILED IN THE U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION JAN 3 - 1916 FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, by EmL Deputy 2x
